column4: nvidia driver can't install on dell e6400 NVIDIA-Linux-x86-177.80-pkg1.run
any help welcome and thank you
I was googling for solution for last few days non of solutions didn't work :-(
2.6.35-30-generic-pae
this error http://pastebin.com/THFKzNGt
that what I have installed http://pastebin.com/RY7JJPJP
E: Unable to locate package nvidia-graphics-drivers-173
looks like was attempting to install a new kernel
that was a mistake install new kernel :-(
well possibly no, might of been an update that is all
yes the problem my laptop down for 2 second day and I don't see solution

I'd run sudo apt-get -f install. anything damaged or misisng will be pulled, but from those massaged, accessing ca.ubuntu.com timing out  I assume a network side issue. not on your side, but to that url whereever it's trying to pull that update from
I would connect it via a network cable to the network and run that to repair it. if you have no connection, then check if network is connecting by typing in sudo ifconfig eth0
the question right now how to restore the nvidia driver
should show you an ip there.
is no internet connection problem I am be able go to internet, and network up and running

you can do this. reboot it. at the prompt select "ubuntu recovery mode" > Then select load default driver> This will load a basic vga driver for you. at the login prompt> select "ubuntu classic" (or it will just tell you it has to load into classic mode by default)> Then once in goto System>Administration> Additional Drivers> Select the Recommended Nvidia Driver and apply changes> Then reboot
that like a solution let me try thank you
Then it's just a bad repository it's trying to access right now. run sudo apt-get --autoremove and it will remove conflicting packages and get you stable
let me try reocevery mode
sudo apt-get -f install nvidia-173-kernel-source  ----> this is solution
